faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-residents and non-EU citizens can purchase property in Spain with minimal restrictions. You'll need a NIE (Spanish identification number) and can complete purchases within 4-6 weeks. Many foreign buyers find Spanish property acquisition straightforward, and English-speaking legal professionals are readily available to guide the process.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 7-10% additional costs including transfer tax (3-8% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), and legal fees (500-1,500€). Murcia's transfer tax is approximately 3%, making total acquisition costs roughly €360,000-€375,000 for this property. Mortgage interest rates are currently competitive at 3-4% for 20-year terms.

faqs.question: Heb ik een visum nodig om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: No. Non-EU citizens don't require a visa to purchase property. You'll need a NIE (Spanish tax identification number) obtainable through Spanish embassies or locally upon arrival. Property ownership itself doesn't grant residence rights, though Spain offers residence visas for those demonstrating financial means or those seeking temporary residency (available separately from property purchases).

faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerende voorheffing in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) in Fuente Álamo averages 0.4-0.6% of property value, approximately €1,350-€2,000 yearly for this villa. This is significantly lower than property taxes in UK or North America. Rental income, if applicable, is taxed as income at Spanish rates (up to 45%), though non-resident landlords often engage management companies handling tax obligations.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca offers excellent value, established infrastructure, thriving expat communities, and strong appreciation trends. Property values have increased 8% annually in recent years. The region combines Mediterranean beaches, pleasant climate, quality healthcare, and international amenities—particularly attractive for families and retirees. Fuente Álamo specifically offers better value than coastal towns while maintaining convenient access.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually with Mediterranean climate patterns. Summers are warm (28-32°C) and dry, winters mild (8-15°C), and rainfall minimal. This climate enables year-round outdoor activities and reduces heating costs compared to northern climates. Families appreciate the consistent good weather for children's outdoor play and beach visits.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van België?
faqs.answer: Approximately 1,400 kilometers (870 miles). Direct flights from UK airports to Alicante take 2-3 hours, making weekend visits to family perfectly manageable. Many UK expats maintain dual residences or visit regularly. Alicante-Elche Airport, 45 minutes from this property, offers extensive UK connections including Birmingham, London, Manchester, and Glasgow.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Significantly lower than UK or northern Europe. Grocery shopping costs are 30-40% less, dining out averages €12-18 for quality meals, and utilities are economical. Fuel costs are comparable to Europe. Many expat families report living comfortably on €1,500-€2,000 monthly including all expenses, making retirement or semi-retirement feasible at lower cost than home countries.

The three-bedroom configuration appeals to families, groups, and multi-generational travelers.
